Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Brewer.

Council Member Brewer moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 15, 2006 be adopted and printed by Council Member Comrie.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Comrie moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 15, 2006 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 060310 ZSM, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 23rd Street Development LLC, Manhattan (C060310ZSM)

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution urging the United States Congress to pass the Count Every Vote Act of 2005, introduced in the Senate by Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton (Sen. 450, 109th Cong., (Feb. 17, 2005) ) and in the House by Representative Stephanie Tubbs Jones (H.R. 939, 109th Cong., (Feb. 17, 2005) ) a comprehensive package of pro-democracy, pro-voter legislation that contains the Civic Participation Act of 2005, a measure to restore voting rights in federal elections to ex-offenders who have completed their sentences.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Urging the US Congress to pass the Count Every Vote Act of 2005.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New Jersey State Police Department and the United States Department of Justice to cease portraying Assata Shakur as a terrorist, and calling upon the appropriate authorities to rescind the reward for Shakur’s capture and grant her clemency.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: NJS Police Department and the US Department of Justice to cease portraying Assata Shakur as a terrorist.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Board of Real Estate and the New York State Department of State to adopt appropriate guidelines and enforcement measures on the use of the Internet for real estate business purposes.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Adopt appropriate guidelines and enforcement measures on the use of the Internet for real estate business purposes.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Transportation and the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to develop a comprehensive plan to address truck traffic pollution in the South Bronx area, which is contributing to increased asthma rates among South Bronx children.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Develop a comprehensive plan to address truck traffic pollution in the South Bronx area.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to publishing a list of standard charges for plumbing repairs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Publishing a list of standard charges for plumbing repairs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the exemption of tax liens on residences of certain low-income persons, low-income seniors, and persons with disabilities from the tax lien sale program.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Exemption of tax liens on residences of certain low-income persons, low-income seniors, and persons with disabilities from the tax lien sale program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and the Governor to enact legislation to extend and increase New York City’s property tax rebate program.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Enact legislation to extend and increase New York City’s property tax rebate program.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the date of submission by the mayor of a preliminary management report and the date prior to which the council shall conduct public hearings and the date by which the council shall submit a report or reports pertaining thereto, the date of submission by the director of management and budget and the director of city planning of a draft ten-year capital strategy, the date of submission by the city planning commission of a report on the draft ten-year capital strategy, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary certificate regarding debt and reserves and appropriations and expenditures for capital projects, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report on revenues and expenditures, the date of submission by the community boards of statements in regard to the preliminary budget, the date of submission by the commissioner of finance of an estimate of the assessed valuation of real property and statement of real property taxes due, expected to be received, and uncollected, the date of submission by the mayor of a tax benefit report, the date of submission by the borough boards of statements on budget priorities, the date of submission by the council of estimates of the financial needs of the council, the date of submission by the borough presidents of proposed modifications of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report analyzing the preliminary budget, the date by which the council shall hold hearings and submit recommendations in regard to the preliminary budget, and the date of submission by the campaign finance board of estimates of the financial needs of the campaign finance board, relating to the fiscal year two thousand eight.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: The date of submission by the mayor of a preliminary management report and the date prior to which the council shall conduct public hearings and the date by which the council shall submit a report or reports pertaining thereto.

Items.Title: Application no. 20075167 SCM, a proposed site for PS/IS 263 a 600 seat school facility located at 202 Sherman Avenue, Council District no. 10, Borough of Manhattan.  This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant Section 1732 of the New York State Public Authorities Law.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Landmark, Public Siting and Maritime Uses
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: School Construction, PS/IS 263, Manhattan (20075167SCM)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to approve, an extension of the 421-a tax incentive program that requires longer term affordability of units for low and middle-income New Yorkers by extending the benefit period.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Extension of the 421-a tax incentive program that requires longer term affordability of units for low and middle-income New Yorkers by extending the benefit period.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Extension of the 421-a tax incentive program that requires longer term affordability of units for low and middle-income New Yorkers by extending the benefit period.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Transportation and the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to develop a comprehensive plan to address truck traffic pollution in the South Bronx area, which is contributing to increased asthma rates among South Bronx children.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Develop a comprehensive plan to address truck traffic pollution in the South Bronx area.

Items.Title: Application no. 20075167 SCM, a proposed site for PS/IS 263 a 600 seat school facility located at 202 Sherman Avenue, Council District no. 10, Borough of Manhattan.  This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant Section 1732 of the New York State Public Authorities Law.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Landmarks, Public Siting and Maritime Uses
Items.MatterName: School Construction, PS/IS 263, Manhattan (20075167SCM)

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, January 3, 2007.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
